question_sentence: Keir Starmer had an embarrassing moment at the Labour Party's annual conference involving what food item?
evidence: The PM had an awkward slip of the tongue while speaking to conference delegates about the situation in Gaza, calling for the "return of the sausages" rather than the "hostages".

question_sentence: Prosecutors used a law targeting what terror group to convict a man who took part in a siege of Joe Biden's campaign bus?
evidence: Eliazar Cisneros was one of six Donald Trump supporters involved in boxing in a Biden campaign bus in 2020 in what was judged to be an act of political intimidation under the Ku Klux Klan Act of 1871. Cisneros was ordered to pay $10,000 in compensatory damages and $30,000 in punitive damages.

question_sentence: Boxer Anthony Joshua faced calls to retire after a shock defeat at the hands of which rival heavyweight?
evidence: Joshua lost his IBF world heavyweight title to underdog and fellow Briton Dubois in a one-sided bout at Wembley Stadium. Joshua has shrugged off retirement speculation, insisting he will continue to fight and believes he can regain the title for a third time.

question_sentence: Microsoft is turning to which energy source to support its artificial intelligence operations?
evidence: Microsoft has struck an exclusive deal to source power from the dormant Three Mile Island nuclear plant to meet the high energy demands of its artificial intelligence operations. The tech company plans to restart the plant by 2028.

question_sentence: Self-proclaimed Marxist Anura Kumara Dissanayake has been sworn in as president of which country?
evidence: Dissanayake was sworn in on Monday after winning a three-way race that pitted him against former president Ranil Wickremesinghe and opposition leader Sajith Premadasa. The leftist positioned himself as an outsider who has promised to fight corruption and raise the standard of living following Sri Lanka's 2022 economic collapse.

question_sentence: X has reportedly asked Brazil's top court to lift the block on the platform after agreeing to do what?
evidence: Elon Musk's social media platform has agreed to block sites identified by Brazilian Supreme Court Judge Alexandre de Moraes as spreading misinformation and undermining democracy, reappoint a representative in Brazil and pay accrued fines.

question_sentence: The UK is increasingly unprepared to face what phenomenon, according to leaked government data?
evidence: According to internal data from the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs and the Environment Agency, only 92.6% of England's flood defences are deemed fit for purpose – well below the 98% target. The data was leaked to The Observer ahead of what is forecast to be a wetter than usual autumn.

question_sentence: How many members of Peru's Sodalitium Christianae Vitae movement were expelled by Pope Francis?
evidence: Pope Francis expelled 10 members of the Sodalitium Christianae Vitae, including a bishop and several priests, for their involvement in "sadistic" abuses of power. The Vatican cited a range of offences, saying the expelled individuals were guilty of various forms of physical, mental and spiritual abuse.

question_sentence: "Normal People" author Sally Rooney has released a new novel with what chess-inspired title?
evidence: Rooney's new novel centres on the lives and relationships of brothers Peter and Ivan, the latter of whom is a chess prodigy. Reviews have been positive so far, with The Independent's Jo Hamya saying it shows Rooney at the "full potential of her prowess".

question_sentence: Coca-Cola is discontinuing which new flavour after only six months on the shelves?
evidence: The company is discontinuing its latest flavour, Coca-Cola Spiced, just six months after its launch due to poor sales. Marketed as a new option for younger consumers, the flavour was confusingly non-spicy, but rather a mix of classic Coke and raspberry.

question_sentence: Which massive storm prompted thousands of evacuations across Florida?
evidence: Hurricane Helene’s sprawling strong winds sent water levels rising several feet above normal along Florida’s west coast. The storm has flooded homes and prompted business closures and flight cancellations.

question_sentence: Which country legalized same-sex marriage this week?
evidence: Thailand's landmark marriage equality bill was officially written into law on Tuesday, allowing same-sex couples to legally wed starting in January.

question_sentence: The US and its allies this week called for a ceasefire across the Israel-Lebanon border for how many days?
evidence: The US and several of its allies called for a 21-day ceasefire across the Israel-Lebanon border on Wednesday as they work to prevent a regional war from erupting in the Middle East. In a major escalation, Israel’s military recently intercepted a ballistic missile near its economic center, Tel Aviv, fired by Hezbollah.

question_sentence: As of this week, US households can order more free at-home tests from the US government to detect which virus?
evidence: People in the US can now order more free Covid-19 tests from the federal government as the country heads into respiratory virus season with high levels of the coronavirus already circulating.

question_sentence: At least 10 people in the US have died from listeria infections linked to which recalled products?
evidence: The CDC is continuing to advise consumers to check their kitchens for recalled Boar's Head deli meat. At least 10 people have died from listeria infections linked to the contaminated products and dozens of others have been hospitalized in 19 states.

question_sentence: Congress approved a spending plan to avert a government shutdown, setting up a new funding fight in which month?
evidence: The agreement will fund the government until December 20. While President Joe Biden applauded Congress for “avoiding a costly government shutdown,” lawmakers will now face a series of tough decisions during the holiday season.

question_sentence: Which state will ban all plastic shopping bags at grocery stores starting in 2026?
evidence: “Paper or plastic” will no longer be a choice at grocery store checkout lines in California. The state had already banned thin plastic shopping bags at supermarkets and other stores, but shoppers could purchase bags made with a thicker plastic that purportedly made them reusable and recyclable.

question_sentence: Football Hall of Famer Brett Favre revealed Tuesday he was recently diagnosed with Parkinson’s disease. Which NFL team did he most notably play for?
evidence: The famed quarterback had a storied NFL career, most notably playing for the Green Bay Packers. While with the Packers, Favre won the Super Bowl in the 1996-97 season and won back-to-back-to-back MVPs from 1995-1997.

question_sentence: Mayor Eric Adams was indicted on five federal public corruption charges this week, including bribery and wire fraud. Which city does he serve?
evidence: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has been indicted on five federal charges related to bribery, wire fraud, conspiracy and soliciting campaign contributions from foreign nationals, according to an indictment unsealed Thursday. He has denied any wrongdoing.

question_sentence: What is the name of the baby penguin that went viral online due to its huge size?
evidence: At just nine months old and weighing 50 pounds, Pesto the penguin went viral for already being bigger than his parents at the Sea Life Melbourne Aquarium in Australia.

question_sentence: When is the Kirkwood Plaza Acme Market pharmacy expected to close?
Which restaurant did President Joe Biden hire to cater the Quad Summit held at Archmere Academy?
What prompted the Charcoal Pit to add new sundaes to its menu?
choices: A suggestion from President Joe Biden
A request from the restaurant’s long-time customers
A new management team taking over the restaurant

question_sentence: What ranking did Delaware State University achieve among public Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) in the latest U.S. News and World Report rankings?
What significant announcement did U.S. Senator Tom Carper make regarding his political career?
choices: He will retire at the end of his current term in January 2025.
He will run for re-election in 2024.

question_sentence: Which two Delaware elementary schools were named 2024 National Blue Ribbon Schools?
choices: Major George S. Welch Elementary School and Cedar Lane Elementary School
Holy Family Elementary School and Springfield High School
Marlborough Elementary School and Holy Family Elementary School

question_sentence: Why did Delaware Governor John Carney veto the medical aid in dying legislation?
choices: He believed the bill had overwhelming support from the medical community.
He thought the bill would not pass in the General Assembly.
He wanted to wait for more states to pass similar laws first.

question_sentence: What symbolic gift did Flavor Flav give to U.S. gymnast Jordan Chiles at the MTV Video Music Awards?
In August 2024, how did home sales and prices in Delaware change compared to the previous month?
choices: Home sales increased by 4.97%, and prices decreased.
Home sales remained the same, and prices decreased.
Home sales decreased by 3.21%, and prices increased.

question_sentence: When is the tentative reopening date for the St. Georges Bridge after its renovation?
